ids_info.name: lh_antennas
ids_info.description: Antenna systems for heating and current drive in the Lower Hybrid (LH) frequencies. In the definitions below, the front (or mouth) of the antenna refers to the plasma facing side of the antenna, while the back refers to the waveguides connected side of the antenna (towards the RF generators).

lh_antennas/reference_point.documentation: Reference point used to define the poloidal angle, e.g. the geometrical centre of the vacuum vessel. Used to define the poloidal refraction index under antenna/row. Within lh_antennas IDS: Antenna systems for heating and current drive in the Lower Hybrid (LH) frequencies. In the definitions below, the front (or mouth) of the antenna refers to the plasma facing side of the antenna, while the back refers to the waveguides connected side of the antenna (towards the RF generators).

lh_antennas/reference_point/r.documentation: Major radius. Within lh_antennas IDS: Antenna systems for heating and current drive in the Lower Hybrid (LH) frequencies. In the definitions below, the front (or mouth) of the antenna refers to the plasma facing side of the antenna, while the back refers to the waveguides connected side of the antenna (towards the RF generators). Within reference_point container: Reference point used to define the poloidal angle, e.g. the geometrical centre of the vacuum vessel. Used to define the poloidal refraction index under antenna/row.

In the definitions below, the front (or mouth) of the antenna refers to the plasma facing side of the antenna, while the back refers to the waveguides connected side of the antenna (towards the RF generators). Within reference_point container: Reference point used to define the poloidal angle, e.g. the geometrical centre of the vacuum vessel. Used to define the poloidal refraction index under antenna/row.

In the definitions below, the front (or mouth) of the antenna refers to the plasma facing side of the antenna, while the back refers to the waveguides connected side of the antenna (towards the RF generators). Within antenna container: Set of Lower Hybrid antennas. Within row container: Set of horizontal rows of waveguides (corresponding to different poloidal positions). A power spectrum is provided for each row. Within position container: Position of the middle on the row.

lh_antennas/antenna/row/n_phi.documentation: Refraction index in the toroidal direction. Within lh_antennas IDS: Antenna systems for heating and current drive in the Lower Hybrid (LH) frequencies. lh_antennas/antenna/row/n_pol.documentation: Refraction index in the poloidal direction. The poloidal angle is defined from the reference point; the angle at a point (R,Z) is given by atan((Z-Zref)/(R-Rref)), where Rref=reference_point/r and Zref=reference_point/z. Within lh_antennas IDS: Antenna systems for heating and current drive in the Lower Hybrid (LH) frequencies. In the definitions below, the front (or mouth) of the antenna refers to the plasma facing side of the antenna, while the back refers to the waveguides connected side of the antenna (towards the RF generators). A power spectrum is provided for each row.

lh_antennas/latency.documentation: Upper bound of the delay between input command received from the RT network and actuator starting to react. Applies globally to the system described by this IDS unless specific latencies (e.g. channel-specific or antenna-specific) are provided at a deeper level in the IDS structure. Within lh_antennas IDS: Antenna systems for heating and current drive in the Lower Hybrid (LH) frequencies.
